#Text=Wikinews Shorts : April 19 , 2007
#Text=A compilation of brief news reports for
#Text=Thursday , April 19 , 2007
#Text=.
#Text=Compensation sought for New Zealand 's Internet outage
#Text=Wikinews reported previously on an Internet outage in New Zealand that lasted for over five hours .
#Text=Telecom New Zealand
#Text=, the company that owns and operates the " local loop " , said that they will review compensation for its customers on a case-by-case basis .

column1: #Text=A wholesale ISP is attempting to give its subscribers compensation for the outage .
#Text=CallPlus says that it is asking Telecom for the thousands of dollars it needs to pass on to its affected customers .
#Text=They doubt Telecom will give them the money needed .
#Text=Related news
#Text=" Outage leaves tens of thousands of New Zealanders without Internet " — Wikinews , April 18 , 2007

column1: #Text=Peruvian farmers issue warning to government
#Text=Farmers in Peru striking over the Peruvian government 's stance on coca , have issued an ultimatum .
#Text=The ultimatum appears to be : negotiate within 24 hours , or face roadblocks indefinitely .
#Text=The protests come in response to a coca eradication drive and measures Peruvian president Alan García is taking against cocaine production in the country .
#Text=Peruvian police have arrested the leader of the Shining Path rebel group , Jimmy Rodríguez on charges of organising anti-government protests .
#Text=Sources
#Text=Dan Collyns .
#Text=" Peru coca farmers warn government " — BBC News Online , April 19 , 2007

#Text=2007
#Text=Missile shield to feature in talks
#Text=Meetings are underway at NATO headquarters in an attempt to reassure Russia that the missile defence plans pose no threat .
#Text=The United States maintains the system is to protect against missiles from rogue states , whereas Russia sees the system as compromising its strategic interests in the region .
#Text=In today 's talks NATO allies encouraged the United States to make the planned anti-missile shield capable of covering all of Europe .
#Text=They did this without committing themselves to joining the project .
#Text=Reaction to the proposed system in European states has been mixed .
#Text=" US set for Russia missile talks " — BBC News , April 19 2007

column1: #Text=Mark John . " NATO allies urge U.S. to open missile shield plan " — Reuters , April 19 2007
#Text=Water cuts possible as Australia faces drought
#Text=Irrigation water to a substantial proportion of Australia 's farming regions could be cut due to drought conditions , Australian PM John Howard has warned .
#Text=Mr Howard 's comments concerned the Murray-Darling Basin , one of the largest systems in Australia .
#Text="

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text=If it does n't rain in sufficient volume over the next six to eight weeks , there will be no water allocations for irrigation purposes in the basin  , adding that the drought conditions could continue until May 2008 .

column1: #Text=Rob Taylor .
#Text=" Drought-hit Australia to stop irrigating food bowl " — Reuters , April 19 2007
#Text=Russian plans for Bering Strait tunnel received with skepticism
#Text=Russia

#Text=, in coordination with the government of the United States and Canada , is planning to build a tunnel from Russia to Alaska , Viktor Razbegin , deputy head of industrial research at the Russian Economy Ministry , told reporters in Moscow Wednesday .
#Text=The tunnel is budgeted to cost US$ 65 billion and would take 10 to 15 years to build .
#Text=The tunnel is to provide train and automobile transport between Alaska and the Russian Far East , and to carry petroleum and natural gas pipelines , and high-voltage electrical cable .
#Text=The proposed tunnel is 64 miles long , or about 100 kilometers , in total , and is designed to link with two islands in the Bering Strait .
#Text=The project is expected to have a very positive economic effect in the area .
#Text=Derek Brower , an energy market expert , called the project " absurd " and suggested the Russian government is playing political games to threaten its European customers to sign energy deals .
#Text=" I 've never heard of this plan , " said Sergei Grigoryev , Vice President of oil pipeline monopoly Transneft .
#Text=" To be honest , anyone who look[s ] at the map will realize that the project is too hard to implement , " an anonymous government source told Reuters .
#Text=Sources
#Text=Miro Cernetig and Peter O'Neil .
#Text=" Russia proposes Bering Sea tunnel , railway to B.C. " — Vancouver Sun , April 19 , 2007
#Text=Dmitry Zhdannikov .
#Text=" Russia-Alaska tunnel is far off , if not a pipe dream " — Reuters , April 18 , 2007
#Text=Yuriy Humber and Bradley Cook .
#Text=" Russia Plans World 's Longest Tunnel , a Link to Alaska ( Update4 ) " — Bloomberg News , April 18 , 2007
